snippet: The 15-year-old hedge fund said it planned to transition into a “private investment partnership” that would manage money for its partners and employees.
abstract: BlueCrest Capital Management announces decision to return outside capital, becoming latest hedge fund to either refuse outside capital, return it to investors, or liquidate.

byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: The 15-year-old hedge fund said it planned to transition into a “private investment partnership” that would manage money for its partners and employees.

headline.main: BlueCrest to Close Hedge Fund and Refund Outside Investors
headline.print_headline: BlueCrest to Close Hedge Fund and Give Investors’ Money Back
